intro: Biscutella valentina subsp. laxa, commonly known as the slender biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are typically narrow and linear. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
